verses.verse: Then answered<WH6030> Zophar<WH6691> the Naamathite,<WH5284> and said,<WH559>
Should not<WH3808> the multitude<WH7230> of words<WH1697> be answered?<WH6030> and should<WH518> a man<WH376> full of talk<WH8193> be justified?<WH6663>
Should thy lies<WH907> make men<WH4962> hold their peace?<WH2790> and when thou mockest,<WH3932> shall no<WH369> man make thee ashamed?<WH3637>
For thou hast said,<WH559> My doctrine<WH3948> is pure,<WH2134> and I am<WH1961> clean<WH1249> in thine eyes.<WH5869>
But <WH199> oh that<WH4310> God<WH433> would<WH5414> speak,<WH1696> and open<WH6605> his lips<WH8193> against<WH5973> thee;

And that he would show<WH5046> thee the secrets<WH8587> of wisdom,<WH2451> that<WH3588> they are double<WH3718> to that which is!<WH8454> Know<WH3045> therefore that<WH3588> God<WH433> exacteth<WH5382> of thee less than thine iniquity<WH4480> <WH5771> deserveth.
Canst thou by searching<WH2714> find out<WH4672> God?<WH433> canst thou find out<WH4672> the Almighty<WH7706> unto<WH5704> perfection?<WH8503>
It is as high<WH1363> as heaven;<WH8064> what<WH4100> canst thou do?<WH6466> deeper<WH6013> than hell;<WH4480> <WH7585> what<WH4100> canst thou know?<WH3045>
The measure<WH4055> thereof is longer<WH752> than the earth,<WH4480> <WH776> and broader<WH7342> than<WH4480> the sea.<WH3220>
If <WH518> he cut off,<WH2498> and shut up,<WH5462> or gather together,<WH6950> then who<WH4310> can hinder<WH7725> him?
For <WH3588> he<WH1931> knoweth<WH3045> vain<WH7723> men:<WH4962> he seeth<WH7200> wickedness<WH205> also; will he not<WH3808> then consider<WH995> it?
For vain<WH5014> man<WH376> would be wise,<WH3823> though man<WH120> be born<WH3205> like a wild ass's<WH6501> colt.<WH5895>
If <WH518> thou<WH859> prepare<WH3559> thine heart,<WH3820> and stretch out<WH6566> thine hands<WH3709> toward<WH413> him;
If <WH518> iniquity<WH205> be in thine hand,<WH3027> put it far away,<WH7368> and let not<WH408> wickedness<WH5766> dwell<WH7931> in thy tabernacles.<WH168>
For <WH3588> then<WH227> shalt thou lift up<WH5375> thy face<WH6440> without spot;<WH4480> <WH3971> yea, thou shalt be<WH1961> steadfast,<WH3332> and shalt not<WH3808> fear: <WH3372>
Because <WH3588> thou<WH859> shalt forget<WH7911> thy misery,<WH5999> and remember<WH2142> it as waters<WH4325> that pass away: <WH5674>
And thine age<WH2465> shall be clearer<WH6965> than the noonday;<WH4480> <WH6672> thou shalt shine forth,<WH5774> thou shalt be<WH1961> as the morning.<WH1242>
And thou shalt be secure,<WH982> because<WH3588> there<WH3426> is hope;<WH8615> yea, thou shalt dig<WH2658> about thee, and thou shalt take thy rest<WH7901> in safety.<WH983>
Also thou shalt lie down,<WH7257> and none<WH369> shall make thee afraid;<WH2729> yea, many<WH7227> shall make suit<WH2470> unto<WH6440> thee.
But the eyes<WH5869> of the wicked<WH7563> shall fail,<WH3615> and they shall not escape,<WH4498> <WH6> <WH4480> and their hope<WH8615> shall be as the giving up<WH4646> of the ghost.<WH5315>
